channel.title: VS Code on Daniel Genezini
channel.description: Recent content in VS Code on Daniel Genezini

item.title: VS Code extensions worth trying out
item.description: Introduction Visual Studio Code is the most used IDE according to the Stack Overflow 2022’s Developer Survey and it has lots of extensions to help us be more productive. Even developers who use another main IDE probably use VS Code for some part of their jobs. In this post I’ll show some of the extensions that I use to work, study and write this blog. 1 - Project Manager Project Manager creates an icon in the side bar and lets you save opened folders for quick access.
